Guanaco 
Lama guanicoe 
Least Concern
Mountainous regions of Peru, Bolivia and Chile 
South America
Peru, Bolivia, Chile 
The guanaco is a South American camelid native to mountainous regions of Peru, Bolivia and Chile. It is closely related to the llama, alpaca and vicu√±a. Guanacos live in small bands of females usually led by a male. They stand about 110 cm (43 inches) at the shoulder and weigh about 90 kg (200 pounds). Both sexes are colored pale brown above and white below and have a grayish head
